Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Root causes identified: Escalations add significant overhead/time due to handover process & specialized team availability. Long waiting times before Investigation step especially when ticket moves into Level-2 queue or when theres a shift change causing overnight idle period before resolution can be performed. Unnecessary delays such as extended triage periods (>40-50min) may indicate inefficiencies in triage process or insufficient staffing during peak times. Repeated investigations / re-escalations cause duplication of effort & increased cycle time (#105).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Recommendations: Implement SLA thresholds for each activity; trigger alerts if waiting times exceed thresholds e.g., triage >45min triggers review. Automate handover notifications & pre-fill required information for Level-2 agents so they can start work immediately upon escalation without extra prep time. Introduce cross-shift coverage or overlapping shifts so that tickets investigated late afternoon can be resolved promptly the following shift rather than staying idle overnight e.g., assign a night support team for pending investigations/resolutions scheduled after business hours. Reduce unnecessary re-investigations by ensuring proper knowledge base updates & training so Level-1 agents can handle more issues without escalation where possible this reduces overall cycle time and backlog accumulation that leads backlogs during off-hours causing delays later in the process chain (#104).
